title: Client Beta Update #2: Replacing the Legacy Client

replies.body: ... this is annoying. I prefer the LEGACY client over the new client cant we just keep a setting to change back and forth between clients? I get better FPS on the older client and my computer is trash as it is. and i'm sure other people don't have very good computers either.

The legacy client is built on an old framework, you won't be able to use the new features such as the practice tool, also, it's much messier for the developers to fix bugs for the old client, and they'd wish to not have to try to support it (not supporting it while you can go on it would look bad).

Also, the new client is constantly getting a better low-spec mode, which causes the client to run better on older computers, by the time the old client is retired, it'll probably run faster than the old client.

Welp, there goes just about any chance of my day turning out good.
Personally my problems with the "updated" client isn't that my computer is "low-spec" or any of the other bullshit everyone else seems to go on about.
Sure, not having item sets or having bots in custom games is kind've annoying but that's barely even scratching the surface of why this and the client is a terrible idea so far.

Everything is in your face and important things are pushed away;
For the sake of having a bigger champ selection screen they stuffed the chat box in away in a corner and it's all so obnoxious now.
The general look of the client too feels like it every aspect of it was designed by a different person as opposed to the legacy client who's menu all have a (mostly) uniform look to them.

The shop still loads a web-page instead of accessing simple images and stored information in the client to show you a god damn in-game menu that has to reload to the featured items page every time you click on the store icon.

When loading a champion's details page, all of the videos for their abilities are automatically loaded without so much as a "by your leave" instead of waiting for the user to press play on them individually.
Yeah sure, Riot. I just want a refresher on what Lucian's Q looks like, I TOTALLY want to watch the rest of his abilities too.

Don't get me wrong, there are some features of the Beta Client that are neat, but as someone who changes their load-out or sometimes even what champion I'm playing is like playing {{champion:96}} without {{summoner:4}} to me when I have absolutely no way of knowing what team colour I'm on whilst in champ select in anything but ranked.

Why did they take away the tinted displays of "Your Team" and "Enemy Team"? That was such a simple and easy way of notifying players of what side of the map they're starting (and sometimes finishing) on.

Why am I not able to change both of my summoner spells at once and instead have to go through the idiotic song and dance twice?

Why on the legacy client can I instantly change my runes and masteries several times in the time it takes for once mastery page change to go through on the beta client?

Why does the friend!chat look like facebook? It's like Riot is trying way too hard to be cool and hip like your dad. Just give me Yellow and Blue text on names, I don't care what order, then a little : and then white text for one persons messages and ever so slightly grayed for the other persons. Don't need any of this stupid background crap or sparkly jingles whenever you get a message.

I see no reason at all why we should be forced to use this pathetically limiting "upgrade" and for one hope I'm not one of the unlucky few "small group of randomly-selected players" in Phase 1 so that I can remain enjoying the good old days where I know what I'm going to get when I click ANY button and that's ALL I get.

To all the positive feedback, I can tell you that I regret ever signing up for the new client. I've personally tested custom-built pcs with a base of EVGA 1060ftw+ (vr enabled,pre-overclocked, benchmark easily exceeds most game, running on 40 down - 30 up speed, 22ms,350-450fps 144hz asus monitor, I know you won't be able to read that much Ultra rip), but it cannot handle the spike that comes from champion select switches.  Likewise a spare pc, AMD MSI counterpart with a base of 150-170fps. These 2 pcs can handle any game on the market currently even sc2 without melting the gpu. The client and games will indefinitely lag or disconnect sporadically. The client itself isn't anything special though, it is a downgrade. Judging from the years I've played both Blizzard games and League, it's going to get worse and worse since 2014. As to why that is, you guys can do your own research should you choose to. Do not get hooked in by their "selling point", do your own research and testing. Even if you personally ask a GM, the answer would be the same. Laptop or PC, the answer is still the same. If I could turn back time and go back to the old client, I'd happily take that chance.
